name: Radisson Blu Astrid Hotel, Antwerp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Chose this place because of its central location wanted to park the car and be able to walk everywhere. Very helpful and friendly staff. Had a room on the 4th floor and was worried about street noise from cars and the train station, but it was quiet. Made daily use of the pool and jacuzzi. The mattress and pillows were due for replacement, any more than 2 nights, I'd ask for a room change.
reviews.title: Great central location for shopping, dining and sightseeing

reviews.text: This is an excellent choice for a stay in Antwerp.
reviews.title: This is an excellent choice for a stay in...

reviews.text: It's location across from the main train station is unrivalled and the imposing frontage means you'll find it easily.
reviews.title: very very nice

reviews.text: The reception staff are very efficient and friendly with it. If you have anything valuable in your luggage and need it stored before or after check-in/out, that item is locked in an extra secure area.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: The bedrooms are very comfortable.
reviews.title: Reccomended

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Radisson Blu during Antwerp lag of our Belgium/the Netherlands trip in October. We picked the Radisson Blue because of its proximity to the train station and because of the wonderful comments we read on Tripadvisor. The hotel exceeded our expectations in everyway.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After landing in Brussels, we followed the advice of other Tripadvisor posts and took the direct bus to Antwerp straight from the airport. The bus was clean, had nice seats and was punctual. The ride to Antwerp took about 50 minutes and the bus dropped us off at Antwerp’s “city center” (practically next to the Antwerp train station). The Radisson Blu was right around the corner.
reviews.title: We loved this hotel.

reviews.text: The reception at the front desk was professional and efficient and smiling. Although we had arrived at around 10 in the morning, they gave us a room without hesitation (we had requested for early check in when we reserved the room). The hotel interior was clean and modern and nicely decorated. The room was spacious and nicely appointed. The bathroom was clean and the shower was nice. The bellman who helped us with our bags also gave us a map and highlighted the “must see” places in Antwerp.
reviews.title: Loved It, Would Love to Return

reviews.text: The breakfast the next morning was AMAZING - a gigantic buffet with huge assortments of breakfast goodies and drinks. They will make eggs and omlettes to order. The restaurant was spacious with views of the square and the train station.
reviews.title: Buzzing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not rent a car on this trip and traveled to the various cities via train. Our strategy was to find hotels near the train station to minimize us having to lug our luggage around. The Radisson Blu suited our strategy perfectly. Now, the hotel is a bit of a walk from the true city center, my sister (who is in her sixties) and I (in my thirties) had no problem with the walk.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this modern hotel on a Saturday evening. It is located just across the square from the main railway station. Tram stops are in the square, and the metro adjacent, so it is extremely conveniently placed. The lobby is cool and modern, the service from the staff top class. The room we were allocated was spacious and well maintained. Despite the hotel's positioning, our room was extremely quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent location, superb service

reviews.text: We made a big mistake of booking a table at the Fiskebar restaurant, a tram ride away in the suburbs. Our treatment there was so unsatisfactory ( e.g. mistake over booking, physically pushed aside by one of the waitresses) that we returned to the City Centre, and even though the Radisson Astrid Hotel restaurant was extremely busy, we were quickly found a table and served delightfully and efficiently by staff who really did look after us despite the large number of diners. The breakfast was superb, with a wide range of hot and cold food, buffet style. Our stay at this hotel was a truly excellent experience
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for a sales conference. Hotel was very comfortable and staff were extremely friendly and efficient. Car park right underneath so very easy. Free internet which is great - all hotels should have this these days. TV channel selection was good too as was the breakfast choice. Would have no hesitation in staying here again.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, ambiguous location

reviews.text: Very good hotel, the rooms are very nice decorated and clean. The lobby is large and clean. The hotel 2nd floor is SPA with swimming pool but we didn't have time to check it. The price we paid for a room is fair. The location is good because it is opposite the central station, the famous zoo, close to the diamond bursa and the Jewish quarter to any one who wish to eat or buy kosher food. The hotel is right above large parking lots. The downside of the location are the negative characters wondering around the central station at the evening, on the other hand there are a lot policemen at this area at night.
reviews.title: Exceptionally good!

reviews.text: We were warmly welcomed by a professional staff who also spoke fluent English - which was a relief. Our room was ready when we arrived and there was a dish of fruits and petit fours waiting for us. The view of the Central Station is beautiful. The only downside wsthat weforgot our swim suits so we could not used the pool or the jacuzzi which looked very welcoming when we checked it out. The location is prefect for sightseeing and shopping. I would not stay anywhere else in Antwerp.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Central Antwerp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here after booking train and hotel through Eurostar.
reviews.title: Great location and amenities

reviews.text: The hotel itself is fantastic. I loved the location - right across the road from the train station. The hotel is walking distance from everything. We had a front facing room with a wonderful view of the square and the magnificent train station.
reviews.title: Great overall stay!

reviews.text: It also has the largest, most equipped gym I have ever seen in a hotel. A complete distraction from a good holiday. The pool is small but enjoyable, and the spa/sauna/steam rooms are small - and get crowded in the evenings.
reviews.title: My favorite Antwerp Hotel

reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: I would stay again... in the summer

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night and felt the rooms were great, the staff was very friendly, delicious breakfast and the location was nice and central (however it is around the station so it isnt the loveliest location in town and there are a few stretchers hanging around pretty much like around any central station) it was nice to have underground parking right there as well. I would definitely come back and stay at the radisson blu!
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL - exceeded my expectations!

aka: Radisson Blu Astrid Hotel, Antwerp Hotel Antwerp
description: Designed by American-born architect, Michael Graves, this architecturally impressive Antwerp hotel offers guests contemporary cosmopolitan elegance, while effortlessly mirroring its historic surroundings. Situated across from the city's historic main rail station, this elegant Antwerp hotel makes a perfect starting point for a day of shopping in the chic fashion areas of De Keyserlei, Meir, Sint Andries and Modenatie. Guests can enjoy an award-winning breakfast, relaxing Sunday brunch, or delectable grilled specialties at the hotel's two international restaurants. As from June 2012, direct train from Brussels Airport to Antwerp Central Station.
